00001 /**
00002  * @file   switch.c
00003  *
00004  * @date   2009-04-25
00005  * @author Jean-Lou Dupont
00006  *
00007  * \section Overview
00008  *
00009  *                      This source implements the *switch* function whereby *envelopes*
00010  *                      are presented, turn-wise, to each recipient(s) subscribing
00011  *                      to a particular *bus*.
00012  *
00013  */
00014 #include <stdlib.h>
00015 #include <pthread.h>
00016 #include <errno.h>
00017 #include <sys/types.h>
00018

00020 #include "switch.h"

00022 #include "pool.h"

00027 #define LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_TRUE  1
00028 #define LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_FALSE 0
00029 
00030 // Input Queue
00031 queue *_switch_queue;
00032 
00033 // Switch Thread
00034 pthread_t _switchThread;
00035 int _switchThread_status=0; //not created
00036 
00037 // Subscriptions to busses
00038 // -----------------------
00039 pthread_mutex_t _subscribers_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
00040 litm_connection *_subscribers[LITM_BUSSES_MAX][LITM_CONNECTION_MAX+1]; // index 0 is not used

00065 
00066         int
00067 switch_init(void) {
00068 
00069         if (0== _switchThread_status) {
00070 
00071 
00072                 // init queue *before* launching thread!
00073                 _switch_queue = queue_create(-1);
00074                 __switch_init_tables();
00075 
00076                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "switch_init: queue[%x] ", _switch_queue);
00077 
00078                 pthread_create(&_switchThread, NULL, &__switch_thread_function, NULL);
00079                 _switchThread_status = 1; //created
00080         }
00081 }//
00082 
00083         void
00084 __switch_init_tables(void) {
00085         int b, c;
00086 
00087         for (b=0; b<LITM_BUSSES_MAX; b++)
00088                 for (c=0;c<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX;c++)
00089                         _subscribers[b][c] = NULL;
00090 }
00091 
00092 /**
00093  * Wait for shutdown
00094  *
00095  * Once a litm_send_shutdowm is used, this function
00096  * should be called to neatly shutdown the process.
00097  */
00098         void
00099 __switch_wait_shutdown(void) {
00100 
00101         pthread_join( _switchThread, NULL );
00102 }

00105 /**
00106  * The switch thread dequeues messages from the
00107  *  ``input queue`` and dispatches them to the
00108  *  next connection queue.
00109  */
00110         void *
00111 __switch_thread_function(void *params) {
00112 
00113         litm_code code;
00114         litm_envelope *e;
00115         litm_connection *next, *sender, *current_conn;
00116         litm_bus bus_id;
00117 
00118         char *err_msg;
00119         int sd_flag=LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_FALSE, shutdown_flag=LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_FALSE;
00120         int current;
00121         static char *thisMsg = "__switch_thread_function: conn[%x] code[%s]";
00122 
00123         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_thread_function: STARTING");
00124 
00125         // for stats
00126         long delivered=0, dequeued=0, waited=0, pending=0, busy=0;
00127 
00128         while(1) {
00129 
00130                 //shutdown signaled?
00131                 if (LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_TRUE==shutdown_flag) {
00132                         break;
00133                 }
00134 
00135                 // we block here since if we have no messages
00136                 //  to process, we don't have anything else to do...
00137                 e=(litm_envelope *) queue_get_nb( _switch_queue );
00138 
00139                 if (NULL==e) {
00140                         waited++;
00141                         int result = queue_wait( _switch_queue );
00142                         if (result) {
00143                                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_ERR, "__switch_thread_function: ERROR whilst queue_wait");
00144                                 break;
00145                         }
00146                         continue;  // <===============================================
00147                 } else {
00148                         dequeued++;
00149                 }
00150 
00151 
00152 
00153                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_thread_function: GOT ENVELOPE");
00154 
00155                 // The envelope contains the sender's connection ptr
00156                 //  as well as the ``current`` connection ptr.
00157 
00158                 // When the message is first sent on any bus,
00159                 //  the switch sets the ``current`` connection ptr
00160                 //  to the subscriber's connection ptr; this pointer
00161                 //  is obtained by scanning the ``subscription map``
00162                 //  for the first subscriber to the target bus.
00163 
00164                 // BUT FIRST, we need to know if the envelope
00165                 //  was already processed and just waiting to be
00166                 //  sent!
00167 
00168                 // message was processed and just sits pending
00169 
00170                 if (1==(e->routes).pending) {
00171                         pending++;
00172                         __switch_handle_pending(e);
00173                         continue; // <===================================================
00174 
00175                 }
00176 
00177                 sender       = (e->routes).sender;
00178                 current      = (e->routes).current;
00179                 current_conn = (e->routes).current_conn;
00180                 bus_id       = (e->routes).bus_id;
00181                 sd_flag      =  e->shutdown_flag;
00182 
00183                 //int id = litm_connection_get_id( sender );
00184                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_thread_function: bus[%u] sender[%x] current[%x] envelope[%x] sd[%i] conn_id[%i]", bus_id, sender, current, e, sd_flag, id);
00185 
00186                 int next_index;
00187                 code = __switch_get_next_subscriber(    &next,
00188                                                                                                 &next_index,
00189                                                                                                 sender,
00190                                                                                                 current,
00191                                                                                                 bus_id);
00192 
00193                 switch(code) {
00194                 case LITM_CODE_OK:
00195                         break;
00196 
00197                 case LITM_CODE_ERROR_END_OF_SUBSCRIBERS_LIST:
00198                         __switch_finalize(e);
00199                         // last subscriber... and shutdown?
00200                         if (LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_TRUE==sd_flag) {
00201                                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_thread_function: SHUTDOWN");
00202                                 shutdown_flag = LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_TRUE;
00203                         }
00204                         continue; // <=======================================
00205 
00206 
00207                 default:
00208                         err_msg = litm_translate_code(code);
00209                         int sender_id  = sender->id;
00210 
00211                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_thread_function: code[%s] sender[%x][%i] current[%x][%i] sd[%i] finalize", err_msg, sender, sender_id, current_conn, current, sd_flag);
00212                         __switch_finalize(e);
00213 
00214                         continue; // <=======================================
00215                 }
00216 
00217 
00218                 //adjust envelope
00219                 (e->routes).current      = next_index;
00220                 (e->routes).current_conn = next;
00221 
00222 
00223 
00224 
00225                 // WE ARE GOOD TO GO
00226                 code = __switch_try_sending_or_requeue( next, e );
00227                 err_msg = litm_translate_code(code);
00228 
00229                 switch(code) {
00230                 case LITM_CODE_OK:
00231                         delivered++;
00232                         break;
00233 
00234                 case LITM_CODE_ERROR_END_OF_SUBSCRIBERS_LIST:
00235                         __switch_finalize(e);
00236                         break;
00237 
00238                 case LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE:
00239                 case LITM_CODE_BUSY_CONNECTIONS:
00240                         busy++;
00241                         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, next, err_msg);
00242                         break;
00243 
00244                         /*
00245                          * Attempting to send to an ``inactive``
00246                          *  connection
00247                          */
00248                 case LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_NOT_ACTIVE:
00249                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, next, err_msg);
00250 
00251                         // remove connection and try sending back
00252                         // to head of switch_queue: maybe other
00253                         // recipients are still to be serviced.
00254 
00255                         // Putting NULL in the field ``current``
00256                         // will restart the process of finding
00257                         // a ``next`` recipient for the envelope.
00258                         (e->routes).pending = 0;
00259                         (e->routes).current = -1;
00260                         queue_put( _switch_queue, e );
00261                         break;
00262 
00263                 default:
00264                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, next, err_msg);
00265                         __switch_finalize(e);
00266                         break;
00267                 }
00268 
00269 
00270         }//while
00271 
00272         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_thread_function: ENDING delivered[%li] dequeued[%li] waited[%li] pending[%li] busy[%li]",
00273                                                                                                                         delivered,  dequeued,    waited,    pending,    busy );
00274 
00275         return NULL;
00276 }//END THREAD
00277 
00278 /**
00279  * Handle ``pending`` requests to sent
00280  */
00281         void
00282 __switch_handle_pending(litm_envelope *e) {
00283 
00284         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_handle_pending: BEGIN");
00285 
00286         litm_connection *conn;
00287         litm_code code;
00288 
00289         conn = (e->routes).current_conn;
00290         code = __switch_try_sending_or_requeue( conn, e );
00291 
00292         // if the message was sent or requeued,
00293         //  we are ok but anything else means something
00294         //  went wrong (duh!) and since we are the owner
00295         //  of the envelope/message, we will "recover"
00296         //  by getting rid of the envelope+message.
00297         //  REASON:  the probable cause of errors
00298         //           stems from connection changes
00299         //           and this is not a normal usage pattern.
00300         static char *thisMsg = "__switch_handle_pending: conn[%x] code[%s]";
00301         char *translated_code = litm_translate_code(code);
00302 
00303         switch(code) {
00304 
00305         case LITM_CODE_OK:
00306                 (e->routes).pending = 0;
00307                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, ">>> PENDING DELIVERED conn[%x][%i] envlp[%x]", conn, conn->id, e);
00308                 break;
00309 
00310         case LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE:
00311         case LITM_CODE_BUSY_CONNECTIONS:
00312                 break;
00313 
00314         case LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION:
00315                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, conn, translated_code);
00316                 break;
00317 
00318         default:
00319                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, conn, translated_code);
00320                 __switch_finalize(e);
00321                 break;
00322         }//switch
00323 
00324 }//
00325 
00326 /**
00327  * A client has finished processing a message: send it
00328  *  through through the ``input_queue`` and if all intended
00329  *  recipients have processed it already, it will be finalized.
00330  *
00331  */
00332         litm_code
00333 switch_release(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp) {
00334 
00335         if (NULL==conn) {
00336                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00337         }
00338         if (NULL==envlp) {
00339                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE;
00340         }
00341 
00342         // if a message comes this way, it means a client
00343         // has finished processing it... get rid of the
00344         // "pending" state if at all present.
00345         (envlp->routes).pending = 0; //precaution
00346         envlp->released_count ++;
00347         conn->released++;
00348 
00349         //{
00350         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "~~~ RELEASE conn[%x][%i] released[%i] envelope[%x] sender[%x][%i]", conn, conn->id, conn->released, envlp, (envlp->routes).sender, (envlp->routes).sender->id);
00351         //}
00352 
00353         int result = queue_put(_switch_queue, (void *) envlp);
00354         if (1 != result) {
00355                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "switch_release: RE-QUEUE ERROR, conn[%x] envelope[%x]", conn, envlp );
00356                 __switch_finalize( envlp );
00357                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC;
00358         }
00359 
00360         // if this was the last 'shutdown' message to be released
00361         //  ... or we got stuck somehow
00362         queue_signal( _switch_queue );
00363 
00364         return LITM_CODE_OK;
00365 }//
00366 
00367 /**
00368  * Tries sending the envelope along BUT requeue if this is
00369  *  not possible at this juncture.
00370  *
00371  *  The call to __switch_try_sending_to_recipient is connection safe.
00372  *
00373  */
00374         litm_code
00375 __switch_try_sending_or_requeue(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp) {
00376 
00377         if (NULL==envlp)
00378                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE;
00379 
00380         litm_code result = __switch_try_sending_to_recipient(conn, envlp);
00381 
00382         if (LITM_CODE_OK==result) {
00383                 (envlp->routes).pending = 0;
00384                 envlp->delivery_count++;
00385         }
00386 
00387         // requeue in switch
00388         if (LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE==result) {
00389 
00390                 envlp->requeued++;
00391                 (envlp->routes).pending = 1;
00392                 queue_put_head( _switch_queue, envlp );
00393 
00394         }
00395 
00396         // a connection dropped out... no big deal,
00397         // just requeue as it was the first go
00398         if (LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_NOT_ACTIVE==result) {
00399 
00400                 envlp->requeued++;
00401                 (envlp->routes).pending = 0;
00402                 queue_put_head( _switch_queue, envlp );
00403 
00404         }
00405 
00406         return result;
00407 }//
00408 
00409 /**
00410  * Try sending the message to the recipient.
00411  *
00412  * This function does not block waiting for the recipient.
00413  * This function should only be called by ''__switch_try_sending_or_requeue''.
00414  */
00415         litm_code
00416 __switch_try_sending_to_recipient(      litm_connection *conn,
00417                                                                         litm_envelope *env) {
00418 
00419         if (NULL==conn) {
00420                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_ERR, "__switch_try_sending_to_recipient: NULL connection" );
00421                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00422         }
00423 
00424         if (NULL==env) {
00425                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_ERR, "__switch_try_sending_to_recipient: NULL envelope" );
00426                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE;
00427         }
00428 
00429 
00430         litm_code returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK;
00431         int code = 0;
00432 
00433         switch(env->shutdown_flag) {
00434 
00435         // more pressing....
00436         case LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_TRUE:
00437                 code = queue_put_head_wait(conn->input_queue, (void *) env);
00438                 break;
00439 
00440         case LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_FALSE:
00441                 code = queue_put_nb(conn->input_queue, (void *) env);
00442                 break;
00443         }
00444 
00445 
00446         switch(code) {
00447         case 0: //error
00448                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_ERROR_OUTPUT_QUEUING;
00449                 break;
00450         case 1: //success
00451                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_try_sending_to_recipient: DELIVERED to conn[%x][%i] envlp[%x] sender[%x][%i]", conn, conn->id, env, (env->routes).sender, (env->routes).sender->id);
00452                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK;
00453                 break;
00454         case -1: //busy
00455                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE;
00456                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_ERR, ">>> BUSY conn[%x][%i]", conn, conn->id );
00457                 break;
00458         case 2:
00459                 // TODO this definitely needs fixing!
00460                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_NOT_ACTIVE;
00461                 (env->routes).current = -1;
00462                 (env->routes).current_conn = NULL;
00463                 break;
00464         }
00465 
00466         return returnCode;
00467 }//
00468 
00469 
00470         litm_code
00471 switch_add_subscriber(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id) {
00472 
00473         if (NULL==conn) {
00474                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00475         }
00476 
00477         if (( LITM_BUSSES_MAX < bus_id ) || (0>=bus_id)) {
00478                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS;
00479         }
00480 
00481         int code = pthread_mutex_trylock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00482         if (EBUSY==code)
00483                 return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00484 
00485                 code =_litm_connections_trylock();
00486                 if (EBUSY==code) {
00487                         pthread_mutex_unlock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00488                         return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00489                 }
00490 
00491                         int result=LITM_CODE_ERROR_BUS_FULL;
00492                         int index;
00493                         for (index=1; index<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX; index++) {
00494                                 if (NULL==_subscribers[bus_id][index]) {
00495                                         _subscribers[bus_id][index] = conn;
00496                                         result = LITM_CODE_OK;
00497                                         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"switch_add_subscriber: conn[%x] index[%i]", conn, index);
00498                                         break;
00499                                 }
00500                         }
00501 
00502                 _litm_connections_unlock();
00503 
00504         pthread_mutex_unlock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00505 
00506         return result;
00507 }//
00508 
00509         litm_code
00510 switch_remove_subscriber(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id) {
00511 
00512         if (NULL==conn) {
00513                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00514         }
00515 
00516         if (( LITM_BUSSES_MAX < bus_id ) || (0>=bus_id)) {
00517                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS;
00518         }
00519 
00520         int code = pthread_mutex_trylock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00521         if (EBUSY==code)
00522                 return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00523 
00524                 code =_litm_connections_trylock();
00525                 if (EBUSY==code) {
00526                         pthread_mutex_unlock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00527                         return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00528                 }
00529 
00530                         int result=LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND;
00531                         int index;
00532                         for (index=1; index<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX; index++) {
00533                                 if (conn==_subscribers[bus_id][index]) {
00534                                         _subscribers[bus_id][index] = NULL;
00535                                         result = LITM_CODE_OK;
00536                                         break;
00537                                 }
00538                         }
00539 
00540                 _litm_connections_unlock();
00541 
00542         pthread_mutex_unlock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00543 
00544         return result;
00545 }//
00546 
00547 
00548 /**
00549  * @see switch_send
00550  *
00551  */
00552         litm_code
00553 switch_send_shutdown(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id, void *msg, void (*cleaner)(void *msg)) {
00554 
00555         if (NULL==conn) {
00556                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00557         }
00558 
00559         if (( LITM_BUSSES_MAX < bus_id ) || (0>=bus_id)) {
00560                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS;
00561         }
00562 
00563         return __switch_safe_send( conn, bus_id, msg, cleaner, LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_TRUE);
00564 }//
00565 
00566 /**
00567  * This function just queues up the message in the
00568  *  switch's input_queue without actually sending it
00569  *  to recipients.
00570  *
00571  *  This function blocks whilst accessing the switch's
00572  *  ``input_queue`` but no deadlock scenario is possible
00573  *  since the switch's thread does not block whilst dequeuing.
00574  *
00575  */
00576         litm_code
00577 switch_send(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id, void *msg,
00578                         void (*cleaner)(void *msg)) {
00579 
00580         if (NULL==conn) {
00581                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00582         }
00583 
00584         if (( LITM_BUSSES_MAX < bus_id ) || (0>=bus_id)) {
00585                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS;
00586         }
00587 
00588         return __switch_safe_send( conn, bus_id, msg, cleaner, LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_FALSE);
00589 }//
00590 
00591 
00592         litm_code
00593 __switch_safe_send( litm_connection *sender,
00594                                         litm_bus bus_id,
00595                                         void *msg,
00596                                         void (*cleaner)(void *msg),
00597                                         int shutdown_flag ) {
00598 
00599         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__SWITCH_SAFE_SEND: sender[%x][%i] bus[%i] sent[%i]", sender, sender->id, bus_id, sender->sent);
00600 
00601         litm_envelope *e=__litm_pool_get();
00602         e->cleaner = cleaner;
00603         (e->routes).pending = 0; //FALSE
00604         (e->routes).bus_id = bus_id;
00605         (e->routes).sender = sender;
00606         (e->routes).current = -1;  // First time sent
00607         (e->routes).current_conn = NULL;  // First time sent
00608         e->msg = msg;
00609         e->delivery_count = 0;
00610         e->released_count = 0;
00611         e->shutdown_flag = shutdown_flag;
00612         e->requeued = 0;
00613 
00614         /*
00615          *  Initial message submission: if something goes
00616          *  wrong, we need to get rid of envelope.
00617          */
00618         int result;
00619 
00620         switch(shutdown_flag) {
00621 
00622         // more pressing....
00623         case LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_TRUE:
00624                 result = queue_put_head_wait(_switch_queue, (void *) e);
00625                 break;
00626 
00627         case LITM_SHUTDOWN_FLAG_FALSE:
00628                 result = queue_put_wait(_switch_queue, (void *) e);
00629                 break;
00630         }
00631 
00632         litm_code code;
00633         switch(result) {
00634 
00635         // BUSY
00636         //  The client will have to re-submit
00637         case -1:
00638                 code = LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00639                 __litm_pool_recycle( e );
00640                 break;
00641 
00642         // OK
00643         case 1:
00644                 code = LITM_CODE_OK;
00645                 sender->sent++;
00646                 break;
00647 
00648         default:
00649                 code = LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC;
00650                 __litm_pool_recycle( e );
00651                 break;
00652         }
00653 
00654         //just enough to let the chance to someother thread
00655         usleep(1);
00656         //sched_yield();
00657 
00658         return code;
00659 }//
00660 
00661 /**
00662  * Finalizes a message contained
00663  * in an envelope & recycles the
00664  * envelope
00665  *
00666  */
00667         litm_code
00668 __switch_finalize(litm_envelope *envlp) {
00669 
00670         if (NULL==envlp) {
00671                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE;
00672         }
00673 
00674         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_finalize: envlp[%x] rel[%i] del[%i]", envlp, envlp->released_count, envlp->delivery_count );
00675 
00676         void (*cleaner)(void *msg) = envlp->cleaner;
00677 
00678         if (NULL==cleaner) {
00679                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_finalize: envelope[%x] freeing", envlp );
00680                 free( envlp->msg );
00681         } else {
00682                 (*cleaner)( (void *) envlp->msg );
00683         }
00684 
00685         __litm_pool_recycle( envlp );
00686 
00687         return LITM_CODE_OK;
00688 }//
00689 
00690 
00691 /**
00692  * Scans the subscription map for the subscriber that
00693  * follows ``current``.  If ``current`` is NULL (thus
00694  * indicating the start of the scan), then pull the
00695  * first subscriber from the subscription to bus ``bus_id``.
00696  *
00697  * Furthermore, we are implementing ``split horizon``
00698  *  forwarding ie. don't send the message back to the
00699  *  originator.
00700  *
00701  * If end of list is reached, return NULL.
00702  *
00703  * CASES:
00704  * ======
00705  *
00706  * 1- empty subscription list
00707  * 2- single subscriber
00708  *    a) the sender
00709  *    b) other subscriber
00710  * 3- more than 1 subscriber
00711  *
00712  */
00713         litm_code
00714 __switch_get_next_subscriber(   litm_connection **result,
00715                                                                 int *result_index,
00716                                                                 litm_connection *sender,
00717                                                                 int  current,
00718                                                                 litm_bus bus_id) {
00719 
00720         litm_code returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK; //optimistic
00721 
00722         *result = NULL; //precaution
00723         int ref;
00724 
00725 
00726         // FIND FIRST {{
00727         if (-1==current) {
00728                 ref = 0;
00729         } else {
00730                 ref = current;
00731         }
00732         // }}
00733 
00734         // at this point, we are looking for the recipient
00735         // after ``current`` but that isn't ``sender`` nor NULL, end-of-subscribers
00736 
00737         int foundMatch = __switch_find_match(sender, ref, bus_id);
00738 
00739         if (0==foundMatch) {
00740                 *result = NULL;
00741                 *result_index = -1;
00742                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_ERROR_END_OF_SUBSCRIBERS_LIST;
00743         } else {
00744                 // we found ``current``...
00745                 // need the following subscriber
00746                 // without forgetting about split-horizon!
00747                 *result = _subscribers[bus_id][foundMatch];
00748                 *result_index = foundMatch;
00749                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK;
00750         }//foundMatch
00751 
00752 
00753         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_get_next_subscriber: END");
00754 
00755         return returnCode;
00756 }//
00757 
00758 /**
00759  * Find ``match``
00760  *
00761  * THIS FUNCTION IS NOT *CONNECTION SAFE* and
00762  *  thus must be called whilst holding the _connections lock.
00763  *
00764  */
00765         int
00766 __switch_find_match(litm_connection *sender, int ref, litm_bus bus_id) {
00767 
00768         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_find_match: BEGIN");
00769 
00770         int index, result = 0;
00771         litm_connection *sub;
00772 
00773         for (index=ref+1; index<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX; index++) {
00774 
00775                 sub=_subscribers[bus_id][index];
00776                 if ((sub!=sender) && (sub!=NULL)) {
00777                         result = index;
00778                         break;
00779                 }
00780         }
00781 
00782         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "### MATCH: sender[%x][%i] ref[%i] bus[%u] result[%u]", sender, sender->id, ref, bus_id, result);
00783 
00784         return result;
00785 }//
00786 
00787         litm_connection *
00788 __switch_index_to_connection( int bus_id, int index ) {
00789 
00790         return _subscribers[bus_id][index];
00791 }
